doc.title: Dixieland
doc.plot: This entry in the "See America First" series focuses on the ten years prior to the US Civil War. We see monuments and buildings associated with people and places of that era. Some of these are: a monument to slaves in Nachitoches, Louisiana; the Brunswick, Maine home of 'Harriet Beecher Stowe' (qv), where she wrote the novel "Uncle Tom's Cabin"; Fort Nashboro in Nashville, Tennessee; composer 'Stephen Foster (III)' (qv)'s home in Bardstown, Kentucky; the grave of abolitionist John Brown at his family's farm in North Elba, New York; and 'Andrew Jackson (XI)' (qv)'s home, The Hermitage.
